publisher.value: Health Level Seven Australia (Patient Administration WG)

description.value: This identifier profile defines a Pensioner Concession Card number in an Australian context. This definition supports sending the Centrelink Customer Reference Number (CRN) (also referred to as Unique Identifier Number (UIN) in the Centrelink Concession electronic System (CCeS)) as displayed on the individual's Pensioner Concession Card. An individual's CRN is present as the primary identifier on different concession cards and is used to confirm concessions by most government agencies and utility providers.

definition.value: Pensioner Concession Card number as the Centrelink Customer Reference Number (CRN) (also referred to as Unique Identifier Number (UIN) in the Centrelink Concession electronic System (CCeS)) displayed on the individual's Pensioner Concession Card.

short.value: Coded identifier type for Pensioner Concession Card number
Centrelink CRN as displayed on the Pensioner Concession Card

comment.value: A Centrelink CRN is a 10 character identifier in the format of 9 digits ending with a letter.
